summary.p: The Vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam is a narrative telling the legend of Vaḷḷi, the consort of Murukaṉ. It appears to be an epitome of the Kantapurāṇam (Taylor 1845, p. 61).
The manuscript gives the text (mūlam) interspersed with a commentary/summary, thus the title given as Vaḷḷiyammaipuṟāṇacāram.
The text is incomplete. See description of U2 and mention of missing folios.

support.p: The edges of U2, f108‒f113 and f202‒f213 are rounded.

collation.desc: 1 folio = tile page. Single folio. Verso blank. Hand #1.

248 folios = text = mūlam. Tamil foliation 1‒30, 32-62, 64, 66, 68-69, 69-209, 247-288. f31, f63, f65, f67, f210‒f246 missing. f68‒f69 refoliated 67‒68. 2 folios foliated 69. 5 to 6 lines per page, by several hands (see fr288, rm).

supportDesc.condition: Fairly good state of preservation, considering the age of the manuscript and in spite of bore holes caused by insects. Some folios are truncated.

additions.desc:
Title written (incised) in two parts on the front and back wood covers
vaḷḷiyāmma
ṉ pūrāṇam
Thus: vaḷḷiyāmmaṉ pūrāṇam [i.e. purāṇam]. The front woodcover is further inscribed pu ta (in smaller letters), that is, puttakam (?).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lf = library foliation = lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.
